intro: Dalea wrightii var. wrightii, commonly known as Wright's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to full sun, making it a hardy species suitable for xeriscaping. Its root system helps prevent soil erosion, contributing to its ecological importance in its native habitat.
